page.title: 10METHODIST CHAPEL, FREELAND
page.content:
The chapel is almost opposite the church, at the corner of Pigeon House Lane. It is older than the church, as it was built in 1805. A small rectangular stone building with round headed windows, it is much plainer than the church, both inside and out.
Inside it has been refitted with a cloakroom and a small kitchen for making coffee. The floor has been covered with brown carpet tiles, and a cross has been made in the floor carpet tiles of a darker brown. The seats are plastic and moveable, and the only Victorian furniture left is the wooden dais and rail, and reading desk. At the back there is an old harmonium but the electric organ is used for services.
